abstract: Chevron learned that “60 Minutes” was preparing a potentially damaging report about contamination of the rain forest in Ecuador, so it hired a former journalist to produce its own favorable report.
snippet: Chevron learned that “60 Minutes” was preparing a potentially damaging report about contamination of the rain forest in Ecuador, so it hired a former journalist to produce its own favorable report.
lead_paragraph: What did Chevron do when it learned that “60 Minutes” was preparing a potentially damaging report about oil company contamination of the Amazon rain forest in Ecuador? It hired a former journalist to produce a mirror image of the report, from the corporation’s point of view.

headline.main: When Chevron Hires Ex-Reporter to Investigate Pollution, Chevron Looks Good
headline.print_headline: When Chevron Hires Ex-Reporter to Investigate Pollution, Chevron Looks Good
